A Perfect Copy OF ALL SUMMONS OF THE NOBILITY TO THE GREAT COUNCILS AND
PARLIAMENTS OF THIS REALM, From the XLIX. of King Henry the IIId. Until these
present Times.

With Catalogues of such Noblemen as have been summoned to Parliament in right
of their Wives, and of such other Noblemen as derive their Titles of Honor
from the Heirs-Female from whom they are descended; and of such Noblemens
eldest Sons as have been summoned to Parliament by some of their Fathers Titles.

Extracted from Public RECORDS, By Sir WILLIAM DVGDALE Knight, Garter Principal
King of Arms.

LONDON, Printed by S. R. for Robert Clavell at the Peacock in St. Paul's
Churchyard. M DC LXXXV.

Celsissimo, potentissimo, nobilissimoque Principi

THE PREFACE.
THAT the great Councils of this Nation, commonly called Parliaments,
consisting sometimes only of the Prelates and Temporal Lords; but for the most
part of the Prelates, great Barons, and Commons, were always convened by the
Kings of this Realm; or those, who at the time of the Sovereign's being in
Foreign Parts, were authorized to do it, as it is sufficiently manifest from
History and Records; so it is not gainsaid by the most rigid Antimonarchists
and wildest Sectaries. Nevertheless, such has been the Art and Industry of
those common Disturbers of our Peace (as we plainly see) that they have as well
publicly, as clandestinely, made it their endeavor to persuade the World,
That the Supreme Power, and absolute Sovereignty does totally reside in the
People, and consequently in the Knights of Shires, Citizens, and Burgesses of
the Cities and Buroughs of this Realm, as their Representatives; though their
Electors have no other power to make choice of them, than ad faciendum, and
consentiendum hiis, quae de Communi Consilio totius Regni ordinari contigerit;
To do and consent to what shall happen to be determined by the Common Council
of the whole Realm; as the words of the Writ, for convening them to Elect, do
clearly import.

By which Argument for fixing the Supreme Power in the People, the King is to
be no other, in effect, than a Ministerial Officer to the Multitude, and to
give an Account to that confused Rout, when and as often as they shall require
it; as also to undergo such Punishment, for his not governing to their mind, as
in their vain and giddy Fancies they esteem most fit. Which pernicious Doctrine
(totally destructive to Government) has been but of a late original here; and
not at all known until the Presbyterians, in imitation of the Jesuits and
other Romish Emissaries, who ascribe the Power of setting up, and deposing
Kings to the Pope, did first broach it.

As to the Persons of whom the House of Commons, in such great Councils did
anciently consist, there are those, who to gain favor with the Vulgar, have
not stuck to aver, That every petty Freeholder of any Land whatsoever, was, in
times past, actually a Member thereof, and thereby sufficiently qualified to
come and vote therein: and, consequently, have endeavored to instill into
their Heads that absurd Opinion, to the end that the Supreme power in the
Multitude might be the better countenanced.

But for a full manifestation of the contrary, the Great Charter of King John
(which in these days has been so much magnified) is evidence sufficient: which
shows, That those great Councils (most known by the name of Parliaments) did
anciently consist of Three Degrees, or Orders of Men; that is to say, The Lords
Spiritual; id est, The two Archbishops, all the Bishops, most of the Abbots,
and some Priors: and of the Lords Temporal; viz. The Earls and greater Barons;
all which had Summons by Special Writs from the King, directed to each of them
respectively, and represented all that held Lands of them. Of which two Orders
or Degrees the upper House, usually called The House of Peers, consisted: The
Third Degree, which made The House of Commons, being the King's Tenants by
Military Service in Capite, and commonly called the Lesser Barons, who also
then represented those of the Commonalty which held of them.

To the intent also, that it may the better be discerned what manner of Persons
the Lesser Barons were, by whom they which held Lands of them were represented;
I shall desire the Reader to observe that Summons in 24 Edw. 1. which was of
those, who were then required to come to NEWCASTLE upon TINE with Horse and
Arms: As also the Names of those who met at LINCOLN in 29 Edw. 1. and sent that
signification under their Seals to the Pope, whereby they asserted the King of
ENGLAND's Title to the Sovereignty of SCOTLAND: by which it will be evident,
That very many of the Lesser Barons did then join with the Greater Barons; and
at what places they had, at that time, their chiefest Residences.

As to these our Parliaments, which for diverse Ages have consisted of the Lords
Spiritual and Temporal, Knights for the Shires, Citizens and Burgesses, the
Reader is to take notice, That the first Precept for their Summons that is to
he found amongst our Public Records, is of no higher Date than the 49th Year
of King Henry the Third's Reign: which, though it was issued out in the King's
Name, it was neither by his Authority, nor by his Direction; himself and Prince
Edward, his Son, as also the greater part of the Nobility that stood Loyal to
him, having in the Month of May before the Date of those Precepts, been taken
Prisoners by the Rebellious Barons in the Battle of JEWS; and so continued
until that memorable Battle at EVESHAM (which happened in August the next ensuing
Year) wherein the King, by the happy Escape of his Son the Prince, out of the
hands of Montfort Earl of LEICESTER, did totally subdue them.

By which Summons so issued out, it is observable, That none of the Nobility
were then called, but those that had been in Arms against the King, or of their
Confederacy: But, after that time, though the King held a Parliament at
WINCHESTER (as is manifest from our Historians) and that his said Son and
Successor, King Edward the First, had sundry Parliaments after he came to the
Crown, there is not any Memorial of the particular persons thereunto summoned,
to be found upon Record, until the Twenty second Year of his Reign.

But then, as also in those of his Son King Edward the Second, and of his
Grandson King Edward the Third, not only the Spiritual Lords (viz. Archbishops,
Bishops, Abbots, and Priors) and those of the Temporalty, which held their
Lands by Service of Barony were summoned; but sundry others, who for their
Prudence, Military Valor, and Loyalty, being esteemed well deserving, had
special Writs directed to them, when and as often as those Kings thought fit to
require their Advice; who being then only Knights, had the Title of Chivalier
attributed to them (as had those afterward that were not really Knighted) and
were called Peers, being Pares Baronum.

It is not a little observable, That, as after the vanquishing of those
Rebellious Barons in the Battle of EVESHAM, the King, to make up the Class of
the Lords Temporal, in stead of such as had been Disloyal to him, called diverse
Eminent Persons to Parliament, in whose Fidelity he could repose confidence: So
in stead of the Barons Minores, by whom the Commons were for the most part
formerly represented; the said King Edward (in imitation of the Rebellious
Barons) caused a certain number of Knights for the Shires; Citizens for the
Cities; and Burgesses for the Buroughs, to be elected and sent as the
Representative Body of the Commons.

By the Records of which Summons of the Lords Temporal, it is not unworthy to
be noted, That some were never called above once; some twice, or more times;
some during their lives, but not their Descendents: As also, That the Husbands
of sundry Heirs Female had Summons by the Title which the Ancestors of such
Heirs Female enjoyed. So likewise in the case of Coheirs, the Husband of which
of them the Sovereign pleased to honor therewith, and his Descendents by her.

But afterward, when the succeeding Kings did by their Letters Patents raise
such Persons to the Degree and Dignity of Barons, of whose Wisdom and Fidelity
they were well satisfied; they then extended their Favors so far to them, as
to grant, that they and the Heirs Male of their Bodies should have and enjoy
Place, Seat, and Vote in all Parliaments, and public Conventions of this
Realm: So that now their Hereditary Right to be called and sit there is
unquestionable.

It is moreover observable; that if those Persons, or their Descendents became
advanced to the Degree of Vicount, Earl, or other higher Dignity, their Elder
Sons, in their Father's Lifetime, were sometimes called to Parliament by the
Title of such a Barony, as was actually in the Father; and had the like place
and precedence therein, as the Father, by virtue thereof did enjoy before his
Erection to an higher Degree. Which usage still continues, though it be merely
of curtesy to the Son, in regard the real Honor is still in the Father: For
should the Son commit Treason, no Forfeiture could accrue to the Father, nor to
his lawful Issue not Attainted.

Note likewise, that though the Earls of ANGUS, and BOGHAN, which were local
Honors in SCOTLAND, had anciently Summons to our English Parliaments by those
Titles, it was not at all in right of those their Earldoms, but by reason they
were possessed of English Baronies; that is to say, Umfravil Earl of ANGUS, of
the Barony of PRUDHOU in NORTHUMBERLAND; and Strabolgy Earl of ATHOL of the
Honor of CHILHAM in KENT.

Note also, that in those Summons, in stead of the Right Name of the Person
summoned, there is frequently put the Name of the Honor, which he bears by
descent from an Heir Female: As in that of Tuchet, who is sometimes called
Audley (as I have noted in the Index, including the Name of Tuchet with a
Parenthesis:) So likewise the Eldest Son of Fitz-Alan Earl of Arundel, summoned
to Parliament in the Lifetime of his Father, is there called Arundel.

A perfect Catalogue of which Summons of the Lords Temporal, extracted from
those Memorials which are upon Record, I have here exhibited; whereby it may be
observed, that from the Reign of King Henry the Eighth, but most of later time,
Sundry Errors have been committed by the Clerks which have issued out those
Writs, in the Titles of the Temporal Barons: for, instead of giving those,
whose Surnames are their only Titles of Dignity, their right Appellations, they
have added the place, whereby they are only distinguished from others of the
same Name; as Thomae Cromwell de OKEHAM Chivalier; Henrico Sandys de la VINE
Chivalier, and the like; whereas de OKEHAM, and de la VINE ought to have been
omitted; there being no reason for inserting the place, whereof they are
distinguished, unless there were more of the Peers than one of the same
Surname; as Butler of MOORE-PARKE, and Butler of WESTON.

As to the Title of Honor, which is not really the name of the person that
enjoys it, but of some eminent Lordship, or place of Note, the Writ of
Summons ought to run thus (as anciently and regularly it has done) viz.
Georgio Nevill de ABERGAVENNY Chivalier: Roberto Carey de Hunsdon Chivalier,
and so to others, by reason that the true Title of the said George is Lord
ABERGAVENNY, and Lord HUNSDON that of the said Robert Carey.

But where there are two Lords of Parliament of one and the self same paternal
Name, and that Name is the Title of Honor to them both; then they ought
properly to be distinguished by the respective places, which be added unto those
their Titles; as Arundel (of WARDOUR) and Arundell (of TRERYSE) the places of
distinction being put within a Parenthesis.

For the better avoiding therefore of such Errors hereafter, which happen
through the inadvertency of those Clerks, as make out the Writs of Summons, I
have here thought sit to particularize the Names of all these places of Note,
which at this time are the Titles only fixed to some Peers of this Realm, and
by which they are summoned to Parliament; as ABERGAVENNY to Nevill; HUNSDON to
Carey; TENHAM to Roper; BROOK to Grevill; LEXINTON to Sutton; DE LA MER to
Boothe; OSULSTON to Benet; DARTMOUTH to Leg, and GUILFORD to North.

As also the Names of such Ancient Noble Families, from whence by Heirs Female
some of our present Nobility are sprung; which, for their greater Honor, do
bear those Names for their Titles; as Moubray by Howard; De la War by West;
Morley by Parker; Ferrers by Shirley; Fitzwalter by Mildmay; Gray by Yelverton,
Conyers by Darcie, and Chandos by Brugges.

Thinking it also most requisite, for preventing the like confusion which
hitherto has happened in former Writs of Summons, by adding the Name of the
place, which is necessarily inserted into the Creation-patent, to the Name of
the person Created; totally to omit it, except in such case, where there are
more than one of the same Surname; and then, that the Name of such place be
included within a Parenthesis, as before is specified.

Lastly, I shall desire the Reader to observe; that from the time of King Henry
the Eighth, by reason of the loss of those Records of Parliamentary-Summons,
which should be in the Petty-Bagg-Office, I have been necessitated to supply
those defects from the Journals of the House of Peers, which only take notice
of their Surnames; and to add their Christian Names from other Authorities.

Advertisement.
INtroductio ad Latinam Blasoniam, Latin and English. A Work befitting all
Gentlemen, lovers of Armory and the Latin Tongue, By J. Gibbon an Officer at
Arms. Sold by Robert Clavell.

SUMMONITIO AD PARLIAMENTUM ANNO XLIX. Regis Henrici III.
Anno xlix. Regis Henrici Tertii,
Claus. in dorso m. 11.
HENRICUS Dei gratia Rex Angliae, Dominus Hyberniae De veniendo ad Parliamentum
apud London.
and Dux Aquitaniae, venerabili in Christo Patri, R. eadem gratia Episcopo
Dunelm' salutem. Cum post gravia turbationum discrimina, dudum habita in Regno
nostro, chariss. filius Edw. primogenitus noster, pro pace in Regno nostro
assecuranda, and firmanda, obses traditus extitisset; and jam sedata
(benedictus Deus) turbacone praedicta, super deliberationem ejusdem salubriter
providenda, and plena securitate, tranquillitate, and pacis, ad honorem Dei,
and utilitatem totius Regni nostri firmanda, and totaliter complenda; ac super
quibusdam aliis Regni nostri negotiis, quae sine Consilio vestro, and aliorum
Praelatorum and Magnatum nostrorum nolumus expediri, cum eisdem tractatum
habere nos oporteat: Vobis mandamus, rogantes, in fide and dilectione, quibus
nobis tenemini; quod omni occasion postposita, and negotiis aliis
praetermissis, sitis ad nos LONDON', in Octabis Sancti Hillarii proxime
futuris; nobiscum, and cum praedictis Praelatis and Magnatibus nostris, quos
ibidem vocari fecimus, super praemissis tractaturi, and Consilium impensuri: Et
hoc, sicut nos and Honorem nostrum and vestrum, nec non and communem Regni
nostri tranquilitatem diligitis, nullatenus omittatis. Test Rege apud
Wigorniam 14 die Decembris.

Eodem modo mandatum est, Episcopo Karliolensi. Abbati S. Mariae Ebor. Priori
Dunelm. Priori Sanct' Trinitatis Eboraci. Abbati de Seleby. Abbati de Furnes.
Abbati de Fontibus. Abbati de Ryevalle. Abbati de Melsa. Abbati de Rupe. Abbati
de Bella landa. Priori de Bridlington. Priori Sancti Oswaldi. Abbati de
Rufford. Priori de Blyda. Priori de Thurgarton. Priori Karleol'. Abbati de
Whiteby. Priori de Giseburn. Archiepiscopo Eboracensi. Priori de Parco. Decano
Eboracensi.


Eodem modo mandatum est subscriptis, viz. Episcopo London'. Episcopo Wynton'.
Episcopo Exon'. Episcopo Wygorn'. Episcopo Lyncoln'. Episcopo Elien'. Episcopo
Sarum. Episcopo Coventr' and Lich'. Episcopo Cicestren'. Electo Bath' and
Wells. Decano Exon'. Decano de Wells. Decano Sarum. Decano Lyncoln'.


In forma proedicta scribitur Abbatibus and Prioribus subscriptis, sub hac
Data, Test Rege apud WODESTOCKE 24 die Decembris. Abbati Sancti Edmundi.
Abbati de Colcestre. Abbati de Wautham. Priori de Dunstaple. Abbati de Sancto
Albano. Abbati de Bello loco. Electo de Evesham. Abbati de Parco lude. Abbati
Westmonasterio. Abbati de Stanlegh. Abbati Glaston'. Abbati de Lilleshul.
Abbati de Reding. Abbati de Bittlesden. Abbati de Cirencestr'. Priori de
Beuver. Abbati de Waverle. Priori de Lenton. Priori Elienensi. Abbati de
Clervaus. Priori Norwic'. Priori de Stodeley. Priori de Merton'. Abbati S.
Augustini Cantuar'. Abbati de Oseney. Abbati de Certessie. Priori S.
Frideswidae Oxon'. Priori S. Trinitatis Cantuar'. Abbati de Messenden. Abbati
de Hida juxta Winton'. Priori de Lenton. Abbati de Middleton. Abbati de Bello.
Abbati de Cerne. Priori Ordinis de Sempringham. Abbati de Abbotesburie. Priori
de Watton. Abbati de Tavistoke. Priori Hospitalis S. Johannis Jerusalem in
Anglia. Priori de Huntingdon. Abbati de Suleby. Magro' Miliciae Templi in
Anglia. Abbati de Wardon. Abbati Ramesiensi. Abbati S. Jacobi Northampt'.
Abbati de Burgo. Abbati de Leicestre. Abbati de Thorney. Abbati de Kirkested.
Abbati de Crouland. Priori de Eton. Abbati Cestriae. Priori de Cruce Roysia.
Abbati Salop'. Abbati de Kirkestall. Abbati de Hulmo. Abbati de Tame. Abbati de
Bardenei. Priori de Bermundesseie. Priori de Bernwell. Abbati de Lesnes. Abbati
de Merivall. Priori de Leedes. Abbati S. Augustini Bristoll. Priori de Landa.
Abbati de Malmesburie. Priori de Spalding. Abbati de Michelnei. Priori S.
Barthol* London'. Abbati de Abindon'. Priori de Kenelworth. Abbati S. Petri
Glouc'. Abbati de Osolvestone. Abbati de Pershore. Abbati de Teukesburie.
Abbati de Wynchecumbe. Priori de Finesheved, Priori de Coventr'. Abbati de
Middeltone. Priori de Sancto Neoto. Abbati de Valledei. Priori S. Swithini
Wynton'. Abbati de Croxton'.


Item in forma proedicta mandatum est Comitibus and aliis subscriptis; Dat'
apud WODESTOCK 24 die Decembris. Com' Leicestr'. Johanni de Vescy. Com'
Gloucestr'. Radulpho Basset (de Drayton.) Com' Norfolc', and Marescallo
Angliae. Henrico de Hastings. Galfrido de Lucy. Com' Oxoniensi. Roberto de Ros.
Com' Derb. Johanni de Eyvill. Rad' de Camoys. Adae de Novomercato. Rogero de S.
Johanne. Waltero de Colevill. Hugoni le De Spenser, Justic' Angliae. Willielmo
Marmyun. Rogero Bertram. Johanni filio Johannis. Radulpho Basset (de Sapcote.)
Willielmo de Munchensy. Gilberto de Gaunt. Nichol' de Segrave.


Item mandatum est singulis Vicecomitibus per Angliam; quod venire faciant duos
Milites de legalioribus and discretioribus Militibus singulorum Comitatuum, ad
Regem London', in Octab' praedictis, in forma supradicta.

Item in forma praedicta scribitur Civibus Ebor', Civibus Lincoln', and
caeteris Burgis Angliae; quod mittant in forma praedicta duos de discretioribus
and legalioribus, and probioribus, tam Civibus, quam Burgensib' suis.

Item in forma praedicta mandatum est Baronibus, and probis hominibus Quinque
Portuum, prout continetur in Brevi irrotulato inferius.

REX
Vicecomiti Sussex: salutem.
Summonito per quatuor legaliores Milites de Comitatu tuo praedicto, Petrum de
Sabandia apud Pevenseiam, Johannem de Warrenna apud Jews; and Hugonem le Bigod
apud Boseham, quod sint coram nobis and Consilio nostro, in proximo Parliamento
nostro London', primo die Junii; Justitiam facturi and recepturi: Et in pleno
Comitatu tuo proclamari facias; quod quicunque ad opus praedictorum Petri,
Johannis, and Hugonis interim procurare, seu impetrare voluerit, salvum and
securum conductum nostrum ad nos veniendi, morandi, and standi recto, in Curia
nostra, si quis versus eum loqui voluerit, secure veniat: and nos Conductum
hujusmodi ei fieri faciamus. Et habeas ibi nomina quatuor Militum, and hoc
Breve.

T. R.
apud Westm' xix. die Martii. Per Consilium.
Eodem modo mandatum est Vicecomiti Hertfordiae, de Summon' W. de Valence apud
Brekendon.

Per totum Consilium.
Gilbertus de Clare Comes Glouc' and Hertf. m. 6.


Rex Nicholao de Hastings, Custodi terrae Roberti de Ferrariis, Comitis Derby,
salutem.

Hugo Dominus de Humet, Dominus Stanford. m. 5.


De Sigillo Regis Commisso, in absentia Cancellarii, usque ad redditum. m. 5.


SUMMONITIONES AD PARLIAMENTA TEMPORE Regis Edwardi I.
Anno 5 Edw. I.
Clausae in dorso m. 12.
EDWARDVS Dei gratia Rex Angliae, Dominus Hiberniae, De veniendo cum Equis and
Armis.
and Dux Aquitaniae, charissimo fratri and fideli Edmundo Comiti Lancastriae,
falutem. Quia Lewellinus filius Griffini, Principis Walliae, and Accomplices sui,
Rebels and inimici, terras nostras and fidelium nostrorum, in partibus
Marchiae, invaserunt, die in diem invadunt, and homicidia and alia damna and
enormia perpetrarunt: Et idem Lewelinus nobis, prout debet, obedire, contempsit
and contemnit, in nostri praejudicium, and contemptum, and vestri, and aliorum
fidelium nostrorum grave damnum and exhaereditationem manifestum, per quod jam
-- nostram summoneri fecimus, quod sit apud Wygorniam in Octab. St. Johannis
Baptistae, proxime futuris, ad rebellionem dicti Lewellini, and fautorum suorum
reprimendam; Vobis mandamus, quod dictis die and loco intersitis, cum Equis and
Armis, and cum servitio vestro nobis debito, nobiscum parati, exinde proficisci
ad expeditionem nostram contra praedictum Lewellinum and Accomplices suas
Inimicos nostros. Test meipso apud Wyndsor xii. die......Anno Regni nostri
quinto.

Eodem modo mandatum est. Edmundo Comiti Lancastr', fratri Regis. Rogere le
Bygod, Comiti Norfolc' and Marescallo Angl'. Johanni de Britannia, Comiti
Richmund. Alexandr' Common, Comiti de Boghan. Edmundo Comiti Cornub'. Willielmo
de Valenc', Com', de Pembr'. Gilberto de Clare, Comiti Gloucestriae and Hertf'.
Henr' de Lacy, Comiti Lincoln. Willielmo de Bellocampo, Comiti Warw'. Marmaduco
Tweng. Eliae de Rabayn. Richardo de Veere, Com. Oxon'. Petro de Gousse.
Gilberto de Vmfranvill, Comiti de Anegos. Gilberto de Gaunt. Johanni Engayne.
Johanni de Vescy. Johanni de Wahull. Tho. de Furnivall. Hugoni de Nevill.
Johanni filio Johannis de Burgo. Radulpho Basset (de Drayton.) Hugoni Lovell.
Hugoni de Plessetis.


Rot. Vascon. 22 Edw. I.
m. 8. in dorso.
REX dilecto and fideli suo Johanni Wake, salutem. Quia super De veniendo ad
Parliamentum.
quibusdam certis and arduis negotiis Coronam and Regnum nostrum nos ac vos,
honorem nostrum and vestrum tangentibus, volumus habere vobiscum colloquium and
tractatum; vobis mandamus; rogantes, ut in fide and dilectione, quibus nobis
tenemini firmiter injungentes, quatenus, visis praesentibus, omni dilatione and
excusatione postpositis, ac quibuscunque aliis praetermissis; ad nos, ubicunque
in Regno nostro fuerimus, veniatis: Et hoc, sicut nos and honorem nostrum ac
utilitatem Reipublicae regni nostri diligitis nullatenus omittatis. Test Rege
apud Westm' octavo die Junii.

Eodem modo mandatum est. Rogero de Moubray. Regin' de Clyvedon. Ranulpho de
Nevill. Ric' de S. Walerico. Willielmo de Ros. Willielmo Trussell. Gilberto de
Gant. Egidio de Playz. Waltero de Kincunbergh. Thomae de Furnivall. Baroni de
Greystoke. Willielmo le Butiller (de Weryngton.) Johanni filio Reginaldi.
Willielmo de Brayose. Galfrido de Caumvill. Willielmo de Say. Willielmo de
Mortuo-mari (de Attilbergh.) Johanni Pevre. Herberto de S. Quintino. Henr. de
Gray. Johan' de Insula. Simoni d Monte-acuto. Rog' de Huntingfield. Henrico
Huse. Rog' fil' Osberti. Henrico Tregoz. Mich. de Poyninges. Henrico de
Vrtiaco. Petro Corbet. Fulconi filio Warini. Edmundo de Mortuo-mari. Hugoni
filio Henrici. Hugoni Bardulf. Henr. de Tyeys. Theobaldo de Verdon. Simoni de
Pierepont. Simoni Basset. Rog. de Lasceles. Nicholao de Meynill. Willielmo de
Rye. Johanni de Steyngrene. Thomae de Cadurcis. Normanno de Arcy. Edmundo de
Eyncurt. Johanni Marmyun. Roberto Luterell. Willielmo de Kyrkeby. Nich. de
Crioll. Johanni de Norwode. Roberto de Ros (de Work.) Johanni de Columbariis.
Willelmo de Colevill. Radulpho Saunzaver. Johanni de Bella-aqua. Rog' la Ware.
Willielmo de Neyrford. Marmaduco de Twenge. Mathaeo de Loveyn. Willielmo de Ros
(de Ingmanthorpe.) Petro Roscelyn. Willielmo de Cressy.


Anno 22 Edw. I.
Claus. m. 6. in dorso.
REX Vic' Northumbr', salutem. Tibi praecipimus, quod de Comitatu praedicto
duos Milites; and de qualibet Civitate ejusdem Comitatus duos Cives; and de
quolibet Burgo duos Burgenses, de discretioribus, and ad laborandum
potentioribus, sine dilatione eligi; and eos ad nos ubicunque in Regno nostro
fuerimus venire facias; ita quod dicti Milites plenam and sufficientem
potestatem pro se and communitate Comitatus praedicti; and dicti Cives and
Burgenses pro se and communitate Civitatum and Burgorum praedictorum, divisum
ab ipsis tunc ibidem habeant, ad consulendum and consentiendum pro se and
Communitate illa, hiis qui Comites, Barons, and Proceres de Regno nostro
ordinabunt, etc. Test Rege apud Westminster. octavo Octobris.

Consimilia Brevia diriguntur singulis aliis Viceccomitibus Angliae.

REX Vic' Northumbr', salutem. Cum nuper tibi praeceperimus, Claus. 23 E. 1. m.
6. in dorso.
quod duos Milites de discretioribus, and ad laborandum potentioribus ejusdem
Comitatus, de consensu ejusdem eligi, and eos ad nos usque Westmonast' in
Crastino S. Martini proximo futuro, cum plena potestate, pro se, and tota
communitate ejusdem Comitatus venire facias, ad consulendum and consentiendum
pro se and Communitate illa, hiis quae Comites and Barons, and Proceres de
Regno nostro, in dicto Crastino ordinabunt: Tibi praecipimus firmiter
injungentes; quod, praeter illos duos Milites, eligi facias alios duos Milites
legales, and ad laborandum potentes; and eos, una cum dictis duobus Militibus
usque Westmonasterium venire facias; ita quod dicto Crastino sint ibidem, ad
audiendum and faciendum, quod eis tunc ibidem before injungemus; and hoc nullo
modo omittatis; and habeas ibi hoc Breve. Test Rege apud Westminster. ix. die
Octobris.

Eodem modo mandatum est singulis Vicecomitibus ANGLIAE, mutatis mutandis, etc.

Anno 23 Edw. I.
Clausae m. 9. in dorso.
EDWARDVS (etc.) Venerabili in Christo Patri R. eadem gratia De veniendo ad
Parliamentum apud Westmonasterium.
Archiepiscopo Cantuariensi, totius Angliae Primati, salutem. Quia super
quibusdam arduis negotiis, nos and Regnum nostrum, ac vos caeterosque
Praelatos, de eodem Regno, tangentibus, quae sine vestra and eorum praesentia
nolumus expediri, Parliamentum nostrum tenere and vobiscum super hiis
Colloquium habere volumus and tractatum; vobis mandamus in fide and dilectione,
quibus nobis tenemini, firmiter injungentes; quatenus sitis ad nos apud Westm'
primo die Mensis Augusti, proximo futuro, vel saltem infra tertium diem
subsequentem, ad ultimum, nobiscum super dictis negotiis tractaturi and vestrum
Consilium impensuri; Et hoc nullo modo omittatis. Test meipso apud Album
Monasterium xxiij. die Junii, Anno Regni nostri xxiij.

Per Breve de privato Sigillo.

Eodem modo mandatum est Archiepiscopo Eboracensi; Episcopis, Abbatibus,
Prioribus, Magistris Ordinis de Sempringham, and Militiae Templi in Anglia, et
Priori Hospitalis S. Johannis Jerusalem in Anglia, etc. ut supra.

REX dilecto et fideli suo Edmundo Fratri suo, Comiti Lancastriae, salutem.
Quia super quibusdam arduis negotiis nos et Regnum nostrum, ac vos caeterosque
Proceres et Magnates de eodem Regno, quae sine, etc. ut supra: Vobis mandamus
in fide et homagio quibus nobis tenemini, firmiter injungentes; quod sitis ad
nos, etc. (ut supra usque in finem.) Test, ut supra.

Eodem modo mandatum est, singillatim, per Brevia Clausa, Comitibus and
Baronibus subscriptis;

Per Brevia Clausa Dom' Regis.

Videlicet, Willielmo de Valenc', Comiti de Pembroke. Richardo filio Alani,

Anno 23 Edw. I.
Claus. in dorso m. 3.
REX venerabili in Christo Patri R. eadem gratia Cantuariensi De Parliamento
tenendo apud Westmonasterium.
Archiepiscopo, totius Angliae Primati, Salutem. Sicut Lex justissima, provida
circumspectione sacrorum Principum stabilita, hortatur and statuit; ut quod
omnes tangit ab omnibus approbetur; sic and nimis evidenter, ut communibus
periculis pro remedio provisa communiter obvietur. Sane satis nostis; and jam
est (ut credimus) per universa mundi Climata divulgatum, qualiter Rex Franciae
de terra nostra Vasconiae, nos fraudulenter and cautelose decepit; eam nobis
nequiter detinendo: Nunc vero praedictis fraud and nequitia non contentus, ad
expugnationem Regni nostri, class maxima, and Bellatorum copiosa multitudine
congregatis; cum quibus Regnum nostrum and Regni ejusdem Incolas, hostiliter
jam invasit, Linguam Anglicam, si conceptae iniquitatis, proposito detestabili,
potestas correspondeat (quod Deus avertat) omnino de terra delere proponit:
Quia igitur praemissa jacula minus laedunt; and res vestra maxim, sicut
caeterorum Regni ejusdem Concivium agitur, in hac part; vobis mandamus, in
fide and dilectione, quibus nobis tenemini, firmiter injungentes; quod Die
Dominica proxima post Festum Sancti Martini in hieme, proxime futura, apud
Westm' personaliter intersitis: praemunientes Priorem and Capitulum Ecclesiae
vestrae; Archidiaconum, totumque Clerum vestrae Dioc'; facientes quod ijdem
Prior and Archidiaconus, in propriis personis suis, and dictum Capitulum per
unum, idemque; Clerus per duos Procuratores idoneos, plenam and sufficientem
potestatem ab ipsis Capitulo and Clero habentes, una vobiscum intersint, modis
omnibus, tunc ibidem ad tractandum, ordinandum, and faciendum nobiscum, and cum
caeteris Praelatis, and Proceribus, and aliis Incolis Regni nostri, qualiter
sic hujusmodi periculis and excogitatis malitijs obviandum. T. Rege apud
Wengham 30 die Septembris.

Consimiles Literae diriguntur Episcopis Elien', Norwic', Wynton'; caeterisque
Episcopis: necnon Abbatibus and Prioribus.

REX dilecto and fideli suo Edmundo Comiti Cornub', Salutem. Quia super
remediis contra pericula, quae toti Regno nostro hiis diebus imminent,
providendis, vobiscum and cum caeteris Regni nostri Proceribus habere volumus
Colloquium and Tractatum: vobis mandamus, in fide and dilectione, quibus nobis
tenemini, firmiter injungentes; quod Die Dominica proxima post Festum Sancti
Martini in hieme, proxime futura, apud Westm' personaliter intersitis, ad
tractandum, ordinandum, and faciendum nobiscum, and cum Praelatis and caeteris
Proceribus, and aliis Incolis Regni nostri, qualiter sit hujusmodi periculis
obviandis. T. R. apud Cantuariam, primo die Octobris, Anno Regni sui xxiij.

Consimiles Literae diriguntur subscriptis, viz. Willielmo de Valenc' Comiti
Pembrochiae. Gilberto de Vmfravill. Roberto de Brus. Edmundo Comiti Cornubiae.
Ingelgramo de Gynes. Gilberto de Clare, Comiti Gloucestr' and Hertf'. Thomae de
Furnyvall. Radulpho filio Willielmi. Johanni Comiti Warennae. Waltero de
Faucumberge. Rogero le Bigot, Comiti Norf' and Maresc' Angliae. Johanni Baroni
de Greystok. Roberto de Hilton. Humphrido de Bohun, Comiti Heref' and Essex.
Rogero de Lascelles. Roberto Lutrell. Willielmo de Bellocampo, Comiti Warw.
Johanni de Hastings. Roberto filio Walteri. Roberto de Veer, Comiti Oxon'.
Johanni Giffard. Galfrido de Camvill. Hugoni le de Spenser. Johanni de
Monte-forti. Theobaldo de Verdon. Bogoni de Knovil. Nicholao de Segrave
Juniori. Eliae de Albaniaco. Roberto de Tateshale. Jordano Folyot. Thomae de
Berkeley. Henrico Husee. Johanni Bek. Johanni Wake. Fulconi filio Warini.
Rogero de Mowbray. Andr' de Estleigh. Willielmo de Vescy. Hugoni Poynz.
Gilberto de Gaunt. Olivero Dynaunt. Roberto filio Rogeri. Willielmo le
Butiller. Willielmo de Roos (de Werk). Reginaldo de Gray. Ranulpho de Nevill.
Rogero Extraneo. Briano filio Alani. Alano de Plugenet.


Adhuc eodem Anno 23 Edw. I.
Clausae in dorso m. 2.
REX venerabili in Christo Patri..... eadem gratia Cantuariensi De Parliamento
Prorogando.
Archiepiscopo, totius Angliae Primati, Salutem: Licer nuper mandaverimus, quod
Die Dominica proxima post Festum Sancti Martini, quod jam instat, apud Westminster
personaliter interessetis; and quod praemuniretis Priorem and Capitulum
Ecclesiae vestrae; Archidiaconum and totum Clerum vestrae Diocesis; facere^^que
quod iidem Prior and Archidiaconus, in propriis suis personis, and dictum
Capitulum per unum, idemque Clerus per duos Procuratores idoneos plenam and
sufficientem potestatem ab ipsis Capitulo and Clero habentes, una vobiscum
interessent, modis omnibus, tunc ibidem ad tractandum, ordinandum, and
faciendum nobiscum, and cum caeteris Praelatis and Proceribus, and aliis
Incolis Regni nostri, qualiter periculis, quae eidem Regno nostro, hiis diebus,
imminere videntur, poterit obviari. Quia tamen pro Navigio nostro congregando
and parando, quod ad dicti Regni defensionem and hostium nostrorum
impugnationem (annuente Domino) speramus maxim) profecturum; quodque per
omnibus utile credimus festinari in partibus de Wynchelse, moram tam diu facere
nos opportebit; quod dictis die and loco commode non poterimus interesse: vobis
mandamus in fide and dilectione, quibus nobis tenemini, firmiter injungentes,
quod die Dominica proxima ante Festum Beati Andreae Apostoli, proxime futurum;
ad quem diem dictum negotium, ex causa praedicta, duximus prorogandum, apud
Westm' personaliter intersitis, praemunientes praedictos Priorem and capitulum,
Archidiaconem, and Clerum; facientesque quod tunc ibidem intersint, ad
tractandum, ordinandum, and faciendum super praemissis, prout in priori mandato
nostro, vobis inde directo, before continetur. Prorogationem autem hujusmodi
de Diocesi vestra, quorum interest, celeriter nuncietis. T. R. apud Odymere
ijdo die Novembris.

Consimiles Literae, de verbo ad verbum, diriguntur Episcopo Elien'. Episcopo
Norwic'. Episcopo Wynton, etc. (Caeterisque Episcopis; necnon Abbatibus and
Prioribus).


REx dilecto Consanguineo and fideli suo, Edmundo Comiti Cornubiae, Salutem.
Licet nuper vobis mandaverimus; quod Die Dominica proxima post Festum Sancti
Martini, quod jam instat, apud Westm' personaliter interessetis, ad tractandum,
ordinandum and faciendum nobiscum, and cum Praelatis and caeteris Proceribus ac
aliis Incolis Regni nostri, qualiter periculis, quae eidem Regno nostro, hiis
diebus, imminere videntur, poterit obviari. Quia tamen pro Navigio nostro
congregando and parando, quod ad dicti Regni defensionem and hostium nostrorum
impugnationem (annuente Domino) speramus maxim profuturum; quodque per omnibus
utile, credimus festinari, in partibus de Wynchelse, moram tam diu facere nos
opportebit; quod dictis die and loco commode non poterimus interesse: vobis
mandamus, in fide and dilectione quibus nobis tenemini, firmiter injungentes;
quod Die Dominica proxima ante Festum Sancti Andreae Apostoli proximo futur',
ad quem diem dictum negotium, ex causa praedicta, duximus prorogandum apud
Westmonasterium, personaliter intersitis, ad tractandum, ordinandum and
faciendum super praemissis, prout in priori mandato nostro, vobis inde directo,
before continetur. Test Rege apud Odymere ijdo die Novembris.

Consimiles Literae diriguntur subscriptis; viz. Willielmo de Valenc', Comiti
Penbrochiae. Briano filio Alani Gilberto de Vmframvill. Gilberto, de Clare,
Comiti Gloucestriae and Hertford' Roberto de Brus Ingelromo de Gynes. Johanni
Comiti Waren'. Thomae de Furnivall. Rogero le Bigod, Comiti Norff. and
Marescallo Angl' Radulpho filio Willielmi. Waltero de Faucumberge. Humphrido de
Bohun, Comiti Heref' and Essex. Johanni Baroni de Greystock. Rogero de
Lascelles. Willielmo de Bellocampo, Comiti Warw. Roberto Luterell. Roberto
filio Walteri. Roberto de Veer, Com' Oxon' Johanni Giffard. Galfrido de
Camvill. Hugoni le Despenser. Johanni de Monte-forti. Theobaldo de Verdon.
Bogoni de Knovill. Nicholao de Segrave Juniori. Eliae de Albaniaco. Thomae de
Berkley. Jordano Foliot. Johanni Bek. Henrico Husee. Fulconi filio Warini
Johanni Wake. Andreae de Estlegh. Rogero de Mowbray. Hugoni Poyntz. Willielmo
de Vescy. Olivero Dinant. Gilberto de Gaunt. Willielmo le Butiller. Roberto
filio Rogeri. Reginaldo de Gray. Roberto de Ros (de Werk). Rogero Extraneo.
Ranulpho de Nevill. Alano de Plugenet.


Anno 24 Edw. I.
Clausae in dorso. m. 7.
REX venerabili in Christo Patri R. eadem gratia, Cantaariensi De Parliamento
tenendo apud Sanctum Edmundum.
Archiepiscopo, totius Angliae Primati, Salutem. Vestra paternitas plene novit,
qualiter vos and alii Praelati, ac Clerus Regni nostri apud Westm' ultimo
congregati, in concessione decimae reddituum and beneficiorum vestrorum
Ecclesiasticorum, pro defensione Regni ejusdem, usque ad Festum Sancti
Michaelis futurum, prope nobis facta, and a nobis sub spe uberioris subsidii,
in futurum, a vobis and aliis praestandi, admissa, bonum and sufficiens nobis
pro futuro tempore Subsidium, ob eandem terram; nisi interim, inter Regem
Franciae and nos pacem reformari, vel treugas iniri contingeret, dare
promisistis unanimiter and libenter: Cujus quidem reformationi pacis, vel
initio treugarum, dictus Rex Franciae hactenus non consensit: Quocirca vobis
mandamus, in fide and dilectione, quibus nobis tenemini, firmiter injungentes;
quod in Crastino Animarum, proxime futuro, apud S. Edmundum, personaliter,
intersitis: Praemunientes Priorem and Capitulum Ecclesiae vestrae,
Archidiaconum, totumque Clerum vestrae Dioc'; facientesque, quod iidem Prior
and Archidiaconus in propriis personis suis; and dictum Capitulum, per unum,
idemque; Clerus per duos procuratores idoneos, plenam and sufficientem
potestatem ab ipsis Capitulo and Clero habentes, una vobiscum intersint, modis
omnibus tunc ibidem ad ordinandum de quantitate and modo Subsidii memorati.
Test Rege apud Berwick super Twede xxvj. die Augusti.

Consimiles Literae diriguntur Eiscopis Elien', Norwic', Roffen', Dunholm',
Karleol', caeterisque Episcopis, Abbatibus, and Prioribus.

REx dilecto Consanguineo and fideli suo Edmundo Comiti Cornub'. Salutem. Quia
super remediis contra pericula, quae toto Regno nostro hiis diebus imminent,
providendis; vobiscum, and cum caeteris Regni nostri Proceribus habere volumus
Colloquium and tractatum: vobis mandamus in fide and dilectione, quibus nobis
tenemini, firmiter injungentes; quod in Crastino Animarum proxime futuro, apud
Sanctum Edmundum personaliter intersitis, ad tractandum, ordinandum, and
faciendum nobiscum, and cum aliis Regni nostri Magnatibus, etc. qualiter sit
hujusmodi periculis obviandum, and statum ejusdem Regni tutius and utilius
consulendum. Test ut supra, etc.

Consimiles Literae diriguntur subscriptis. Johanni Comiti Warennae. Andr. de
Estleigh. Rogero le Bigot, Com' Norf', and Marescallo Angl'. Willielmo de
Butiller. Gilberto de Vmfravill. Humphrido de Bohun, Com' Heref' and Essex.
Roberto de Brus. Ingelramo de Gynes. Willielmo de Bello-campo, Com' Warr'.
Thomae de Furnyvall. Radulpho filio Willielmi. Roberto de Veer, Com' Oxon'.
Waltero de Faucomberge. Galfrido de Camville. Johanni Baroni de Greystok.
Bogoni de Knovill. Roberto de Hilton. Eliae de Albaniaco. Rogero de Lascells.
Fulconi filio Warini. Reginaldo de Gray. Olivero Dynaunt. Johanni Bek. Alano de
Plugenet. Johanni Hastings. Johanni Wake. Roberto filio Walteri. Rogero de
Mowbray. Johanni Giffard. Gilberto de Gaunt. Hugoni le De Spenser. Roberto
filio Rogeri. Nicholao de Segrave Juniori. Ranulpho de Nevyll. Roberto de
Tatteshale. Simoni Mortymer. Thomae de Berkele. Johanni de Segrave. Hugoni
Poynz. Briano filio Alani. Rogero Extraneo.


Adhuc eodem Anno 24 Edw. I.
Claus. in dorso m. 12.
REX dilecto and fideli suo Rogero le Bigod Com' Norff' and Maresc' De veniendo
cum Equis and Armis apud Novam Castrum super Tynam.
Angl' Salutem. Quia Johannes Rex Scotiae aliqua contra fidelitatis suae
debitum, in laesionem Coronae Regni nostri, ad quam integram and illaesam
conservandam and defendendam, Sacramenti vinculo astricti estis, jam de novo,
(ut accepimus) perpetravit; per quod ad parts Scotiae, in brevi, iter arripere
intendimus, ad apponendum contra hujusmodi perpetrata remedium, quod de nostro
Consilio viderimus opportunum; vobis mandamus, rogantes in fide and dilectione,
quibus nobis tenemini, firmiter injungendo; quatenus primo die Mensis Martij
proxime futuro, sitis ad nos apud Novum Castrum super Tynam, cum Equis and
Armis, quanto decencius and honorabilius poteritis, parati and prompti; ad
faciendum ea, quae tunc temporis de De magno Consilio ibidem tenendo.
nostro Consilio duximus injungendum, ita quod vobis inde grates refer merito
teneamur; quid ante super hiis duxeritis faciendum, nobis quam citius
nuncieritis. Test Rege apud Westm' xvj. die Decembris.

Consimiles Literae diriguntur subscriptis, viz. Willielmo de Bello-campo,
Comiti Warr'. Richardo de Coleshull. Willielmo Bouteveleyn. Johanni Luvell.
Waltero de Pavilly. Johanni Engayne. Galfrido de Stowey. Radulpho Pipard.
Willielmo de Botreus. Alano Plugenet. Jo. Cogan. Roberto filio Pagani. Radulpho
Wake. Eliae de Albaniaco. Richardo de Wyndesor. Johanni de Mueles. Roberto de
London. Johanni de Bello-campo. Radulpho filio Bernardi. Johanni de
Sancto-Johanne (de Lageham). Almarico de Nodariis. Laurencio de Pavelly. Henr.
de Vrtiaco. Johanni de Pabenham Juniori. Hugoni de Plessetis. Johanni de
M^^teyn. Andr. de Estleye. Roberto Russell. Richardo Basset (de Weledon).
Ranulpho de Ry. Roberto filio Walteri, (de Daventre). Thomae de Wyneslee.
Nicholao filio Radulphi. Roberto Hastings. Richardo de Ken. Jo. Peyure. Johanni
de Acton.

fuerunt per Regem ad Guerram Scotiae.]

continentur.

Ranulphus de Nevyle. Richardus de Romundby. Johannes de Lancastre. Thomas de
Hetengton. Robertus Res (de Work.) Johannes Baro (de Greystok.) Johannes le
Caumberleyn. Robertus Bertram. Thomas Saunford. Robertus de la Vale.


Anno 25 Edw. I.
Claus. in dorso m.....
REX dilecto Consanguineo, and fideli suo Edmundo Com' Cornub', De Parliamento
tenendo apud Sarum.
salutem. Quia super quibusdam arduis negotiis nos and vos ac Regnum nostrum
contingentibus, vobiscum, una cum quibusdam aliis Proceribus and Magnatibus
ejusdem Regni habere volumus Colloquium and Tractatum: Vobis Mandamus, in
homagio, fide and dilectione, quibus nobis tenemini, firmiter injungentes; quod
modis omnibus sitis ad nos apud Sarum, Die Dominica in Festo S. Matthiae
Apostoli proximo futuro, ad ultimum, nobiscum super dictis negotiis Colloquium
and Tractatum specialiter habitur, vestrumque Consilium impensuri, and hoc,
sicut nos and honorem nostrum, ac salvationem Regni nostri ac incolarum ejusdem
diligitis, nullatenus omittatis. Test Rege apud Welyng 26 die Januarii.

Consimile mandatum habent singuli Comites, Barons and Milites subscripti;
viz. Rogerus le Bigod, Comes Norff. and Maresc' Angl'. Johannes Giffard. Alanus

Adhuc Anno 25 Edw. I.
Claus. in dorsom. 6.
REX venerabili Patri R. eadem gratia Cantuar' Archiepiscopo, De veniendo ad
Parliamentum apud London'.
totius Angliae Primati, salutem. Quia super quibusdam arduis and urgentibus
negotiis, nos and vos, and totum Regnum nostrum tangentibus, volumus quod
Edwardus filius noster charissimus, tenens locum nostrum in Anglia, vobiscum
Colloquium habeat and Tractatum; vobis mandamus, in fide and dilectione quibus
nobis tenemini, firmiter injungentes, quod instanti Crastino Sancti Michaelis,
London', ad eundem filium nostrum modis omnibus personaliter intersitis, cum
eodem and caeteris de Consilio nostro qui ibidem aderunt, super dictis negotiis
tractaturi, vestrumque Consilium impensuri; and hoc, sicut Honorem and commodum
nostrum diligitis, nullatenus omittatis. Test Edwardo filio Regis apud Sanctum
Paulum London' ix. die Septembris.

Eodem modo scribitur subscriptis, viz. Johanni de Segrave. Alano la Zousche.
Johanni Lovell. Nicholao de Segrave. Roberto filio Rogeri. Rogero le Bigot,
Comiti Norf. and Marescallo Angliae. Fulconi filio Warini. Roberto de
Tateshale. Humfrido de Bohun, Comiti Heref. and Essex. Edmundo de Mortuo-mari.


Anno 26 Edw. I.
Claus. in dorso m. 5.
EDWARD par la grace de Dieu Roi, D'engleterre, (etc.) a son De veniendo cum
Equis and Armis, ad Carleolum.
feall et loiall Rogier Bigod Count de Norf. et Mareschall D'engleterre.
Purceo, que nous beoms estre (al eide de Dieu) a Cardoill, la Veille de la
Pentecoste prochein avenir, pur alar avaunt en la busoigne d'Escoce, sur les
Enemies de la Corone, et du Roialme D'engleterre; et pour leur disobessance et
leur malice refreindre, que a autre chose ne entendent que abesser la dite
Corone et L'estat du dit Roialme D'engleterre, a leur poer; et aussint poer
mettre nos feaux et leaux, ceux as queux, nous a noms terres, dones and
durreins en les parteis d'Escoce en seisine et en estat de leur terres, et
outre ceo fair ceo, que Dieu nous enseignera: Nous vous Priouns especiaument,
e en la fei, e en la ligance que vous estez tenuz a nous, et a la Corone
D'engleterre; fermement enjoignouns; que a dite term de la Veille de
Pentecoste soiez a nous a Cardoill, as Cheuas et Arms, le plus afforcement que
vous purrex, pur aler avaunt en la dite busoigne, selon ceo q'il serra ordene,
par vous et par ler bones Gentz qui serront ove nous a cele heur. Et ceo sicom
vous ames le honeur et le profist de nous, et du dit nostre Roiaume, and le
vostre propre, en nulle manner ne lesses. Donez a Staynwagg le xxvi. jour de
Septembr', L'an de nostre Regne vintesime.

Au teiles Lettres sont mandez as Counts, Barons, and Chivalers suthescrits;
cestasaver, Comites, Johan de Garenne, Conte de Surr. Esmond Conte de
Cornewail. Rauf de Mahermer, Conte de Glouc'. Henry de Lacy, Conte de Nichole.
Humfrey de Bohun, Conte de Heref. Richard Fitz-Alleyn, Conte de Arundell. Guy
de Beauchamp, Conte de Warwik. Tho. Conte de Lancastr. Rob' de Ver, Conte de
Oxenf. Gilberd de Vmframvill, Conte de Anegos. Conte Patrik.
Barons, Henr' de Lancastre. Adam de Well. Aymer de Valenc'. William de
Cauntelae. Humfry de Bohun. Johan d' Engayne. Johan de Ferrars. Johan de
Cauntelae. Henry de Percy, Gilbert Pecche. Johan de Wak. Johan de Claverynge.
Roberd le Fitz-Wauter. Eustace de Hacche. Hugh le Despenser. William Leyburn.
William le Latymer. Johan de Beuchamp (de Somersete.) Roberd de Clifford.
Roberd de Mohaut. William de Graunzon. Johan de Hastings. Richard Syward. Johan
de la Mare. Simon Fresell. Johan de Ryveres. Philip Darcy. Johan de Mohun.
Johan le Strange. Peers de Mauley. Johan del Isle. Robert le Fiz-Payne. Johan
de Suley. Hugh de Curtenay. Simon de Montacue. Tho. de Furnivall. Thomas le
Latymer. Hugh Bardulf. William le Latymer, le fitz. Roberd de Tonny. Wauter de
Teyes. Nichole de Audithele. Wauter de Huntercumb. Thoma de Berkele. Aleyn
Plukenet. William de Breous. Emon de Hastingges. Piers Corbet. Johan de
Lancastre. Williame Martyn. Roberd de Tateshale. Tho. de Multon. Rauf Pipard.
Johan de Gray. Johan de Seint John, le fuiz. Johan ab Adam. Robert la Ward.

Fiz-Roger. Henr' Tyeis. Hugh de Veer. Nicholas de Segrave. Wauter de
Faucumberge. Bryan le Fiz-Alleyn. Joh' de Giffard (de Brymesfeld.) Emond de
Mortimer. Hugh de Mortimer. Wauter de Beauchamp. Fuk le Fiz-Waryn. Piers de
Chauvent. Johan' le Fitz-Renaud. Rauf Basset. Geffrey de Camvill. Roger la
Ware. William le Vavassour. John Paynell. Robert de Hylton. Alisaundre de
Baliol. William Sampson. Hugh Poyntz. William de Ferrers. Nichole de Meignill.
Rauf de Grendon. Roger de Mortymer. William de Morle. William de Rithre. Elys

Anno 27 Edw. I.
Claus. in dorso m. 18.
REX venerabili in Christo Patri R. eadem gratia Cantuar' Archiepiscopo De
veniendo ad Parliamentum apud London.
totius Angliae primati, Salutem. Quia super negotiis nostris ultra marinis
Regni nostri habere volumus colloquium and tractatum; vobis mandamus in fide
and dilectione quibus nobis tenemini, firmiter injungentes, quod prima Dominica
instantis Quadragessimae, apud nos London' modis omnibus personaliter
intersitis; nobiscum ibidem super dictis negotiis tractaturi, vestrumque
Consilium impensuri; and hoc sicut nos, honorem nostrum and vestrum and Regni
nostri commodum diligitis nullatenus omittatis. Test Rege apud Pontem de Tuyle
vj. die Februarij.

Eodem modo mandatum est Episcopis Subscriptis. Episcopis; caeterisque
Episcopis; necnon Abbatibus and Prioribus. Johanni Roffensi, R. London



REx dilecto Consanguineo and fideli suo Edmundo Comiti Cornubiae, Salutem.
Quia super negotiis nostris ultra-marinis, vobiscum and cum caeteris proceribus
Regni nostri habere volumus colloquium and tractatum; vobis mandamus in fide
and homagio quibus nobis tenemini, firmiter injungentes, quod prima Dominica
instantis Quadragessimae ad nos London, etc. intersitis etc. ut supra. Test ut
supra.

Adhuc Anno 27 Edw. I.
Claus. in dorso. m. 16.
REX venerabili in Christo Patri R. eadem gratia Archiepiscopo De Parliamento
tenendo apud Westmonaster'.
Cantuariensi, totius Angl' Primati, Salutem. Propter quaedam specialia and
ardua negotia nos and statum Regni nostri tangentia, quae noviter emerserunt,
and quae sine vestra praesentia nolumus expediri; vos affectuose requirimus and
rogamus, quatinus sitis ad nos apud Westm' in xv. Paschae proxima nunc ventura,
omnibus praetermissis, ad tractandum nobiscum super dictis negotiis, ac etiam
vestrum Consilium impendendum in eis, prout Dominus inspirabit: Et hoc, sicut
de vobis confidimus, and honorem nostrum diligitis, nullatenus omittatis. Test
Rege apud Westm' 10. die Aprilis.

Consimiles Literae diriguntur Episcopis subscriptis, viz. O. Lincoln, etc. R.
Norwic'. J. Wynton'. G. Wigorn'. Caeterisque Episcopis. R. London'.


REx dilectio Consanguineo and fideli suo Edmundo Com' Cornub' Salutem. Propter
quaedam specialia and ardua negotia nos and statum Rni nostri tangentia, etc.
vobis mandamus in fide and homagio, quibus nobis tenemini, firmiter
injungentes; quatinus sitis ad nos apud Westm' in xv. Paschae proxima nunc
ventura, omnibus praetermissis, ad tractandum, etc. Test, ut supra.

Consimiles Literae diriguntur Com' subscriptis, viz. Radulpho de Monte
Hermeri, Com' Glouc' and Hertf'. Roberto de Vere, Comiti Oxon'. Richardo filio
Alani, Com' Arundell. Henrico de Lacy, Comiti Lincoln'. Johanni de War' Comiti
Surr. Though Com' Lancastriae. Rogero le Bigod, Com' Norf' and Marescallo Angl'.
Gilberto de Vmfravill, Com' de Anegos. Guidon' de Bello-campo, Com' Warwici.
Adomaro de Valencia.


REx dilecto and fideli suo Johanni de Hastings, Salutem. Propter quaedam
specialia and ardua negotia, etc. vobis mandamus in fide and dilectione, etc.
ut supra. Test ut supra.

Adhuc eodem Anno 27 Edw. I.
Clausae in dorso. m. 9.
REX venerabili in Christo Patri R. Cantuarien' Archiepiscopo, totius De
veniendo ad Magnum Consilium, London.
Angliae Primati, Salutem. Propter quaedam ardua negotia nos and vos, and Regni
nostri statum urgentem tangentia; vos rogamus, quanto specialius scimus aut
possumus; vobis nihilominus injungendo mandamus, quantinus in proximo Festo
Beati Lucae Evangelistae apud Novum Templum London: personaliter intersitis, ad
habendum, una cum aliis fidelibus nostris, qui ibi intererunt, deliberationem
and Consilium super dictis negotiis, vobis tunc ibidem ex part nostra before
exponendis: and hoc, amore nostri, nullatenus omittatis. Test Rege apud Ledes
vicessimo primo die Septembris.

Consimiles Literae diriguntur subscriptis, viz. Episcopo Dunelm'. Rogero le
Bigod, Comiti Norf' and Marescallo Angliae. Episcopo London'. Episcopo Sarum.
Johanni de Sancto Johanne. Episcopo Coventr' and Lich'; (caeterisque
Episcopis.) Ottoni de Grandisono. Hugoni le Despenser. Edmundo Com' Cornubiae.
Hugoni de Veer. Johanni de Warrenna Comiti Surr'. Roberto filio Walteri. Henr'
de Lacy, Comiti Lincoln'.


Anno 28 Edw. I.
Claus. in dorso m. 17.
REX venerabili in Christo Patri R. eadem gratia Cantuar' Archiepiscopo, De
Parliamento tenendo apud London.
totius Angliae Primati, Salutem. Quia ad salvationem Coronae nostrae regiae,
and communem utilitatem populi Regni nostri, secunda die Dominica
Quadragessimae, proxime futura, London' Parliamentum tenere; and vobiscum, and
cum caeteris Praelatis, necnon Magnatibus, and Proceribus ejusdem Regni, super
negotiis nos and idem Regnum contingentibus, speciale Colloquium habere volumus
and Tractatum: vobis mandamus, in fide and dilectione quibus nobis tenemini,
firmiter injungentes; quod ad praedictos diem and locum personaliter
intersitis; nobiscum, and cum caeteris Praelatis, Magnatibus, and Proceribus
praedictis, super dictis negotiis tractaturi vestrumque Consilium impensuri.
Praemunientes Priorem and Capitulum Ecclesiae vestrae; Archidiaconos, totumque
Clerum vestrae Diocesis; facientesque quod iidem Prior and Archidiac' in
propriis personis suis; and dictum Capitulum per unum, idemque Clerus per duos
Procuratores idoneos, plenam and sufficientem potestatem ab ipsis Capitulo and
Clero habentes, una vobiscum intersint, modis omnibus tunc ibidem; ad faciendum
and consentiendum hiis, quae tunc de communi Consilio (favente Domino) ordinari
contigerit; vel etiam pro utilitate dicti Regni providen: Et hoc sicut nos and
honorem nostrum, Regnique praedicti commodum diligitis nullatenus omittatis.
Test Rege apud Berewicum super Twedam xxix. die Decembris.

Consimiles Literae diriguntur custodibus Episcopatus Lincoln' Sede vacant,
Episcopis London', Citestr', Exon', etc.

Consimiles Literae diriguntur Abbatibus and Prioribus, etc.

REx dilecto and fideli suo Edmundo Com' Cornubiae, Salutem. Quia ad
salvationem Coronae nostrae, and communem utilitatem populi Regni nostri,
secunda die Dominica Quadragessimae, proxime futura, London' Parliamentum
tenere; and vobiscum ac cum caeteris Magnatibus and Proceribus ejusdem Regni
super negotiis nos and idem Regnum contingentibus, speciale Colloquium habere
volumus; and cum caeteris Magnatibus and Proceribus praedictis, super dictis
negotiis tractaturi, and vestrum Consilium impensuri; and hoc, sicut nos and
honorem nostrum dictique Regni commodum diligitis, nullatenus omittatis. Test
Rege apud Berewicum super Twedam xxix. die Decembris.

Consimiles Literae diriguntur subscriptis, viz. Johanni de Warenna, Comiti
Surr'. Hugoni le Despenser. Willielmo le Latymer Seniori. Rogero le Bigod,
Comiti Nors' and Maresc' Angliae. Roberto de Clifford. Roberto de Monte-alto.
Radulpho de Monte-hermer, Com' Glouc' and Hertf'. Johanni de Hastings. Jo. de
la Mare. Henr' de Lacy, Comiti Lincoln'. Jo. de Mohun. Humfrido de Bohun,
Comiti Heref' and Essexiae. Petro de Malo-lacu. Roberto filio Pagani. Richardo
filio Alani, Comiti Arundell. Hugoni de Cartenay. Edmundo D'eyncurt Guid' de
Bello-campo, Comiti Warwici. Jo. de Sancto Johanne (de Lageham) Galfrido de
Genevill. Though Com' Lanc'. Tho. de Furnivall. Roberto de Veer, Comiti Oxon.
Hugoni Bardolf. Gilberto de Vmfranvile, Com' de Anegos. Roberto de Tony. Tho.
de Berkeley. Henr' de Lancastr'. Willielmo de Br^^^sa. Aymero de Valenc'. Petro
Corbet. Johanni de Ferrariis. Willielmo Martyn. Henr' de Percy. Tho. de Multon.
Johanni de Wake. Johanni ab Adam. Roberto fill. Walteri. Philippo de Kyme. Jo.
de Segrave. Edmundo de Hastings. Roberto filio Rogeri. Jo. de Lancastre. Hugoni
de Veer. Roberto de Tateshale. Waltero de Faucumberge. Radulpho Pypard. Petro
de Chauvent. Jo. de Sancto Johanne Juniori. Radulpho Basset (de Drayton).
Roberto le Ward. Rogero la War. Johanni Lovell (de Tichmershe). Johanni
Paynell. Alano la Zousche. Alex. de Balliolo. Henr' Tyeis. Hugoni Poyntz.
Nicholao de Segrave. Rogero de Mortuo-mari. Briano filio Alani. Otoni de
Grandisono. Edmundo de Mortuo-mari. Willielmo de Rithre. Fulconi filio Warini.
Regin' de Gray. Johanni filio Reginaldi. Waltero de Muncy. Galfrido de Camvill.
Roberto de Scales. Willielmo le Vavasur. Adae de Wells. Willielmo Sampson.
Almarico de Sancto Amando. Willielmo de Ferrariis. Willielmo de Cantilupo.

Elyae D'aveney. Jo. de Clavering. Edmundo Baroni de Stafford. Eustachio de

Waltero de Teye. Serloni de Lansladron. Waltero de Huntercumbe.


REx dilecto and fideli suo Philippo de Willoughby Cancellario Scaccarij sui,
Salutem. Quia ad salvationem Coronae nostrae, and communem utilitatem populi
Regni nostri, secunda die Dominica Quadragessimae proximo futura, London'
Parliamentum tenere; and vobiscum; ac cum caeteris de Consilio nostro super
negotiis nos and idem Regnum nostrum contingentibus, speciale Colloquium habere
volumus and Tractatum; vobis mandamus firmiter injungentes, quod ad praedictos
diem and locum personaliter intersitis nobiscum, and cum caeteris de Consilio
nostro super dictis negotiis tractaturi, and vestrum Consilium impensuri: Et
hoc nullatenus omittatis. Test Rege apud Berewicum super Twedam xxix. die
Decembris.

Consimiles Literae diriguntur subscriptis; viz. Rogero Brabazon. Archid'
Cestr'. Willielmo de Ormesby. Magistro Jo. de Derby, Decano Lichfeld. Gilberto
de Ronbury. Magistro Jo. Lovell. Magistro Petro de Insula, Decano Wellen'. Jo.
de Metingham. Willielmo de Bereford. Magistro Jo. de Silveston. Elyae de
Bekyngham. Magistro Jo. de Craucumbe, Archid' Estriding. Petro Mallore.
Willielmo Haward. Magistro Tho. de Luggore. Jo. de Cobham. Magistro Willielmo
de Kilkenny. Willielmo de Carleton. Magistro Jo. de Lacy. Petro de Leicestre.
Magistro Jo. de Cadamo. Jo. de Insula. Magistro Reginaldo de Brandon'. Adae de
Crokedayke. Magistro Petro de Dene. Johanni Inge. Radulpho de Hengham. Johanni
Lovell (de Snotescumb.) Willielmo de Mortuo-mari. Henr' de Guldeford. Magistro
Gerardo de Vippeins, Archid' Richmond'. Rogero de Hegham. Jo. de Betisford.
Johanni de Havering, Justic' Northwall'. Henr' Spigurnell. Roberto de Retford.
Hugoni de Leminstr'. Magistro Roberto de Radeswell,......de Kaernan.


Adhuc eodem Anno 28 Edw. I.
Clausae in dorso m.....
REx venerabili in Christo Patri R. eadem gratia Archiepiscopo Cantuariens. De
Parliamentum tenendo a pud Lincolniam.
totius Angliae Primati, Salutem. Cum nuper, pro communi utilitate populi Regni
nostri, concesserimus; quod Carta de Foresta in singulis suis Articulis
observaretur; assignando quosdam de fidelibus nostris in singulis Comitatibus
ejusdem Regni, in quibus Forestae nostrae desunt, ad Perambulationem in eisdem
Forestis faciendam, ita quod perambulationem illam distinct and apt factam,
ad nos, antequam aliqua executio, vel aliquid aliud inde fieret, reportarent:
Et quod juramentum nostrum, jus Coronae Angliae rations and calumpniae
nostrae, necnon jus, rations and calumpniae aliorum omni, salva forent; nos,
licet dicti fideles nostri nunc primo ad nos detulerint quod fecerimus in
negotio memorato: Quia tamen Praelati, Comites, Barons, and caeteri Magnates
dicti Regni, in quorum praesentia nostras and aliorum proponi and audiri
volumus rations; and de quorum Consilio in eodem negotio, prout alias diximus,
intendimus operari; maxim, cum ipsi ad observandum and manutenendum jura Regni
and Coronae praedictae, una nobiscum, juramenti vinculo sunt astricti, juxta
latus nostrum tunc temporis non fuerunt; Ac pro eo similiter; quod illi, qui
suas rations, quatenus illud negotium eos tangit, proponere habebant, inde
praemuniti, non erant, eidem negotio, sine ipsorum Consilio finem imponere non
potuimus bono modo: Et quia negotium illud, quantum possumus, cupimus maturari,
ita quod per nos non stet, quin absque ulterioris dilationis incommodo,
effectum debitum formatur: volentes cum Praelatis, Comitibus, Baronibus and
Magnatibus supradictis, ac aliis de Communitato dicti Regni, super hoc and
quibusdam aliis arduis negotis nos and statum Regni nostri praedicti
tangentibus, habere Colloquium and Tractatum; vobis mandamus, in fide and
dilectione, quibus nobis tenemini, firmiter injungentes, quod sitis ad nos ad
Parliamentum nostrum apud Lyncoln' in Octabis Sancti Hilarij proximo futuro;
nobiscum, una cum caeteris Praelatis and Proceribus praedictis, super
praemissis, tractaturi, vestrumque Consilium impensuri: Et hoc, sicut nos and
commodum Regni nostri praedicti diligitis, nullatenus omittatis. Test Rege
apud la Rose xxvj. die Septembris.

Consimiles Literae diriguntur T. Archiepiscopo Ebor'. caeterisque Episcopis;
necnon Abbatibus and Prioribus.

REx dilecto and fideli suo Johanni de Warrenna Comiti Surr', Salutem. Cum
nuper pro communi utilitate, etc. ut uspra usque ibi vobis mandamus in fide and
homagio, quibus nobis tenemini, firmiter injungentes; quod sitis ad nos ad
Parliamentum nostrum apud Lincoln' in Octabis Sancti Hilarij proximo futuro;
nobiscum ibidem, una cum Praelatis and Proceribus praedictis; super praemissis
tractaturi vestrumque Consilium impensuri; Et hoc, sicut nos and commodum Regni
praedicti diligitis, nullatenus omittatis. Test Rege apud la Rose xxvj. die
Septembris.

Consimiles Literae diriguntur Comitibus, Baronibus and Militibus subscriptis;
viz. Rogero le Bygod, Comiti Norf. and Marescallo Angliae. Aymero de Valencia.
Jo. de Ferrariis. Radulpho de Montehermer, Com' Glouo' and Hertf'. Henr' de
Percy. Roberto filio Walteri. Humfrido de Bohun, Comiti Heref. and Essexiae.
Willielmo le Latymer Juniori. Roberto de Clifford. Richardo filio Alani, Comiti
Arundell. Roberto de Monte-alto. Johanni de Hastings. Guid' de Bello-campo,
Comiti Warr'. Johanni de la Mare. Johanni de Ripariis. Thomae, Comiti
Lancaster'. Johanni de Mohun. Roberto de Veer, Comiti Oxoniae. Roberto filio
Pagani. Gilberto de Vmfravil, Comiti de Anegos. Hugoni de Curtenay. Edmundo
D'eyncurt. Henr' de Lancastria. Johanni de S. Johanne (de Lageham.) Eustachio

Thomae de Berkeley. Johanni Extraneo. Willielmo de Brewosa. Johanni de Insula.
Petro Corbet. Johanni de Suley. Willielmo Martyn. Simoni de Monte-acuto. Thomae

Exemplar Literarum Penes Thesaur. and Camerarios Scaccarii.
Angliae Procerum, in Parliamento apud Lincolniam convenientium, Anno 29 Regis
Edwardi Primi, summo Pontifici porrectarum, supremum Dominium Regni Scotiae,
Regibus Angliae, de jure debitum, audacter vendicantium.

Sanctissimo in Christo Patri, domino B. divina providentia S. Romanae
Ecclesiae summo Pontifici, sui devoti filii. JOhannes Comes Warennae. Humfridus
de Bohun, Comes Hereford' and Essexiae, ac Constabularius Angliae. Thomas Comes
Lancastriae. Radulphus de Monte-hermerii, Comes Gloucestr' ac Hertford'. Guido
Comes Warewike. Richardus, Comes Arundell. Thomas de Furnivall, dominus de
Sheffeild. Adomarus de Valencia, Dominus de Montiniaco. Thomas de Multon,
dominus de Egremond. Henricus de Lancastre, dominus de Munemue. Willielmus le
Latimer, dominus de Corby. Johannes de Hastings, dominus de Bergavenny. Thomas
de Berkele. Henricus de Percy, dominus de Topclive. Fulco filius Warini.
Johannes, dominus de Segrave. Edmundus de Mortuo-mari, dominus de Wiggemore.
Edmundus de Eyncourt, dominus de Thurgarton. Robertus filius Walteri, dominus
de Wodeham. Petrus Corbet, dominus de Cauz. Johannes de S. Johanne, dominus de
Hannak. Willielmus de Cantilupo, dominus de Ravensthorpe. Hugo de Veere,
dominus de Swanescampis. Johannes de Bello-campo, dominus de Hacche. Willielmus
de Breuhosa, dominus de Gower. Rogerus de Mortuo-mari, dominus de Penketlyn.
Robertus de Monte-alto, dominus de Hawardyn. Johannes filius Reginaldi, dominus
de Blenleveny. Robertus de Tatteshale, dominus de Buckenham. Ranulphus de
Nevill, dominus de Raby. Reginaldus de Gray, dominus de Ruthyn. Brianus filius
Alani, dominus de Bedale. Henricus de Gray, dominus de Codenoure. Willielmus
Mareschallus, dominus de Hengam. Hugo Bardulfe, dominus de Wyrmegeye. Walterus
de Huntercombe. Willielmus Martyn, dominus de Camesio. Robertus de Tonny,
dominus de Castro-Matildis. Henricus de Ties, dominus de Chilton. Willielmus de
Ros, dominus de Hamlake. Rogerus la War, dominus de Isefeld. Robertus de
Clifford, Castellanus de Appelby. Johannes de Ripariis, dominus de Anger.
Petrus de Malolacu, dominus de Mulgreve. Johannes de Lancastre, dominus de
Grisdale. Philippus, dominus de Kyme. Robertus filius Rogeri, dominus de
Clavering. Robertus filius Pagani, dominus de Lanwor. Johannes de Mohun,
dominus de Dunsterre. Henricus Tregotz, dominus de Garinges. Almaricus de S.
Amando, dominus de Wydehaye. Radulfus Pipard, dominus de Lanford. Alanus le
Zuche, dominus de Astaeby. Walterus, dominus de Faucomberge. Willielmus de
Ferrariis, dominus de Groby. Rogerus le Estraunge, dominus de Ellesmere.
Theobaldus de Verdon, dominus de Webbele. Johannes le Estraunge, dominus de
Cnokyn. Thomas de Chaurcis, dominus de Norton. Eustachius dominus de Hacche.
Gilbertus Pecche, dominus de Corby. Walterus de Bello-campo, dominus de
Alcester. Willielmus Paynel, dominus de Tracyngton. Ricardus Talebot, dominus
de Eckleswell. Bogo de Knovill, dominus de Albomonasterio. Johannes Bottetourt,
dominus de Mendesham. Fulco le Strange, dominus de Corfham. Johannes Engaine,
dominus de Colum. Henricus de Pynkeney, dominus de Wedone. Hugo Poynz, dominus
de Cory-Malet. Johannes de Hudlestone, do minus de Aneys. Adam, dominus Well.
Simon, dominus de Monteacuto. Rogerus de Huntingfelde, dominus de Bradenham.
Johannes, dominus de Sulle. Hugo filius Henrici, dominus de Ravenswath.
Johannes de Moeles, dominus de Caudeburie. Johannes le Breton, dominus de
Sporle. Edmundus Baro Stafford. Johannes Lovel, dominus de Berekingg. Nicholaus
de Carru, dominus de Mulesford. Edmundus de Hastings, dominus de Enchimchelmok.
Thomas, dominus de la Roche. Walterus de Moncy, dominus de Thornton. Radulphus
filius Willielmi, dominus de Grymthorpe. Johannes filius Marmaduci, dominus de
Hordene. Robertus de Scales, dominus de Neuseles. Johannes dominus de
Kingeston. Willielmus Touchet, dominus de Levenhales. Robertus Hastang, dominus
de Desiree. Johannes ap Adam, dominus de Beverstone. Radulphus dominus de
Grendone. Johannes de Haveringes, dominus de Grafton. Willielmus dominus de
Leyburne. Robertus la Ward, dominus de Alba-aula. Johannes de Greystoke,
dominus de Morpeth. Nicholaus de Segrave, dominus de Stowe. Matthaeus filius
Johannis, dominus de Stokenhame. Walterus de Teye, dominus de Stangrove.
Nicholaus Meynill, dominus de Wherletone. Johannes de Lisle, dominus de
Wodeton. Et Johannes Paynel, dominus de Otteleye.


Devota Pedum oscula beatorum.

SAncta Romana matter Ecclesia, per cujus ministerium fides Catholica
gubernatur, in suis actibus cum ea, sicut firmiter credimus and tenemus
maturitate procedit; quod nulli praejudicare, sed singulorum jura, non minus in
aliis, quam in seipsa, tanquam matter alma conservari valet illaesa. Sane,
convocato per serenissimum Dominum nostrum EDWARDVM, Dei gratia Regem Angliae
illustrem, Parliamento apud Lincolniam generali: idem Dominus noster quosdam
Literas Apostolicas, quas super certis negotiis, conditionem and statum Regni
Scotiae tangentibus, ex part vestra receperat, in medio exhiberi, and seriose
fecit nobis exponi. Quibus auditis, and diligenter intellectis, eam nostris
sensibus admirando, quam hactenus inaudito, in eisdem audivimus contineri.
Scimus enim (Pater Sanctissime,) and notorium est in partibus Angliae; and
nonnullis aliis non ignotum; quod a prima institutione Regni Angliae, Reges
ejusdem Regni, tam temporibus Britonum, quam Anglorum, superius and directum
Dominium Regni Scotiae habuerunt; and in possessione, vel quasi Superioritatis,
and directi Dominii ipsius Regni Scotiae, successivis temporibus extiterunt:
nec ullis temporibus ipsum Regnum in temporalibus pertinuit, vel pertinet
quovis jure ad Ecclesiam supradictam, quinimo idem Regnum Scotiae
progenitoribus praedicti Domini nostri Regibus Angl', atque sibi feodale
extitit ab antiquo. Nec etiam Reges Scotorum, and Regnum, aliis quam Regibus
Angliae subfuerunt, vel subjici consueverunt. Neque Reges Angliae super juribus
suis in Regno praedicto, aut aliis suis temporibus, coram aliquo Judice
Ecclesiastico, vel seculari, ex libera praeheminentia status suae Regiae
dignitatis, and confuetudinis cunctis temporibus irrefragabiliter observatae
responderunt, aut respondere debebant.

Unde, habito tractatu, and deliberatione diligenti, super contentis in vestris
literis memoratis; communis concors, and unanimis omnium and singulorum
consensus fuit, est, and erit inconcusse (Deo propitio) in futurum; quod
praefatus Dominus noster Rex, super juribus Regni sui Scotiae, aut aliis suis
temporalibus nullatenus judicialiter respondeat coram vobis, nec judicium
subeat quoquo modo; aut jura sua praedicta in dubium questionis deducat; nec ad
praesentiam vestram procuratores aut Nuncios ad hoc mittat; praecipue cum
praemissa cederent manifest in exhaereditationem juris Coronae Regni notoriam;
necnon in praejudicium libertatum, consuetudinum, and legum paternarum; ad
quarum observationem and defensionem, ex debito praestiti juramenti
astringimur; and quae manutenebimus toto posse, totisque viribus (cum Dei
auxilio) defendemus.

Nec etiam permittimus, aut aliquatenus permittemus, ficut nec possumus, nec
debemus, praemissa tam insolita, indebita, praejudicialia, and alias inaudita,
praelibatum Dominum nostrum Regem, etiamsi vellet facere, seu quomodolibet
attemptare.

Quocirca Sanctitati vestrae reverenter and humiliter supplicamus, quatenus
eundem Dominum nostrum Regem; qui inter alios Principes Orbis terrae, Caholicum
se exhibet, and Ecclesiae Romanae devotum, jura sua, libertates, consuetudines,
and leges, absque diminutione and inquietudine pacifice possidere, and ea
illibata persistere benignius permittatis.

In cujus rei testimonium Sigillis nostris, tam pro nobis, quam pro tota
Communitate praedicti Regni Angliae, praesentibus sunt appensa.
Datae apud Lincolniam xii. die Februarii, Anno Domini MCCCI. (29 Edw. I.)

Nomina Magnatum, qui ad dictum Parliamentum Anno xxix. Regni Regis Edwardi
Primi, apud Lincolniam Convocatum nequaquam summoniti erant; cujus Sigilla,
veruntamen dictis Literis, Summo Pontifici amandatis, affixa erant. Henricus de
Gray (de Codnoure.) Henricus Pinkney (de Wedon.) Willielmus de Ros (de Hamlak.)
Johannes Hudleston (de Aneys.) Petrus de Malolacu (de Mulgrave.) Rogerus
Huntinfeld (de Bradenham.) Theobaldus de Verdon (de Webley. Ranulphus Nevill
(de Raby.) Hugo filius Henrici (de Ravenswath.) Henricus Tregoz (de Garinges.)
Johannes le Breton (de Sporl) Rogerus le Strange (de Ellesmere.) Nicholaus de
Carru (de Molesford.) Thomas de Chaurcis (de Norton.) Walterus de Bello-campo
(de Alcester.) Johannes filius Marmaduci (de Hordene.) Ricardus Talbot (de
Eccleswell.) Johannes de Kingeston. Johannes Botetourt (de Mendlesham.)
Robertus Hastang (de Desiree.) Johannes de Moels (de Cadbury.) Johannes de
Greystoke (de Morpeth.) Johannes de Haverings (de Grafton.) Matthaeus filius
Johannis (de Stokenhame.) Walterus de Teyes (de Stangreve.) Nicholaus Meynill
(de Wherletone.) Will' Paynel (de Tracington.) Fulco le Strange (de Corfham.)


Nomina illorum, qui ad istud Parliamentum summoniti erant, cujus Sigilla
domino Papae emissa, non sunt appensa. Rogerus Bigod, Comes Norf. Johannes de
Clavering. Johannes de Ferrers. Willielmus de Grandison. Johannes de la Mare.
Philippus D'arcie. Hugo de Curtenay. Thomas de Latimer. Petrus de Champvent.
Willielmus le Vavasor. Radulphus Basset (de Drayton.) Elias D'aubeny. Alexander
de Balliol. Andraeas de Estle. Willielmus de Rither.


Adhuc Anno 29 Edw. I.
Claus. in dorsom....
REX dilecto and fideli suo Johanni de Warenna Comiti Surr', De veniendocum
Equis and Armis.
salutem. Quia contra Scotos Rebels nostros, and notorie proditores, in
praeconcepta malitia, and malignitatis astutia perdurantes, ad ipsorum
Rebellionem and proterviam reprimendam, post Festum Pentecostes proximo
futurum, in quo tempore dictis Scotis, ad requisitionem Regis Franciae, per nos
nuper concessae finientur intendimus procedere, Deo propitio, viriliter and
potenter; vos affectuose requirimus and rogamus, quatenus sitis ad nos apud
Berewicum super Twedam, in Festo S. Johannis Baptistae proximo venturo, cum
Equis and Armis, etc. Test Rege apud Lincoln' decimo quarto die Februarii.

Consimiles Literae diriguntur Comitibus, Baronibus, and Militibus subscriptis,
viz. Humfrido de Bohun, Comiti de Heref. and Essex'. Johanni de Ferrariis.
Henrico de Percy. Guidoni de Bellocampo, Comiti Warr'. Roberto filio Walteri.
Hugoni le Despenser. Henrico de Lancastr'. Willielmo le Latimer Seniori.
Roberto de Veer, Comiti Oxon'. Roberto de Monte-alto. Gilberto de Vmfranvill,
Comiti de Anegos. Willielmo de Leyburne. Aymero de Valencia. (Cum plurimis
aliis.)


Anno 30 Edw. I.
Claus. de eodem anno, in dorso. m. 9.
REX venerabili in Christo Patri R. eadem gratia Cantuar' Archiepiscopo, De
Parliamento tenendo apud London.
Angliae Primati, salutem. Licet vos non lateat, qualiter in Parliamento nostro
habito Londoniis, hiis diebus extitit ordinatum; ut ad providendum consultius,
and salubrius ordinandum super negotiis de quibus tractatum fuit in eodem
Parliamento, and aliis; super quibus, pro commodo and securitate Regni nostri,
and Incolarum ejusdem tractandum videbitur, Parliamentum iterato, in proximo
Festo S. Michaelis Londoniis habeatur: Ex habundanti tamen vobis, in fide and
dilectione, quibus nobis tenemini, firmiter injungendo mandamus; quod eidem
futuro Parliamento, aliis quibuscunque negotiis praetermissis, personaliter
intersitis. Test Rege apud Westmonasterium vicesimo quarto die Julii.

Consimiles Literae diriguntur subscriptis; viz.

Johanni Karleolensi Episcopo, etc. Caeterisque Episcopis, etc.

REX Edwardo Principi Walliae and Comiti Cestriae, filio suo charissimo,
salutem. Licet vos non lateat, etc. ut supra. Ex habundanti tamen vobis, in
fide and homagio, quibus nobis tenemini, firmiter injungendo mandamus; quod
eidem futuro Parliamento, etc. personaliter intersitis. Test, ut supra.

Consimiles Literae diriguntur subscriptis, viz. Johanni de Warenna, Comiti
Surriae. Willielmo de Roos (de Hamlak.) Rogero le Bigod, Comiti Norf. and
Marescallo Angliae. Willielmo de Ferrariis. Rogero La War. H. de Lacy, Comiti
Lincoln'. Johanni Paynell. Radulpho de Monte-hermerii, Comiti Gloucestr' and
Hertf. Alexandro de Balliolo. Hugoni Pointz. Humfrido de Bohun, Comiti Heref.
and Essexiae. Rogero de Mortuo-mari. Willielmo de Rithre. Thomae, Comiti
Lancastr'. Reginaldo de Gray. Guidoni de Bellocampo, Com' War'. Waltero de
Muncy. Roberto de Veere, Com' Oxon'. Roberto d'Escales. Gilberto de Vmframvill,
Comiti de Anegos. Adae de Well. Almarico de S. Amando. Henrico de Lancastre.
Willielmo de Cantilupo. Adomaro de Valencia. Johanni Engayne. Hugoni le
Despenser. Gilberto Pecche. Johanni de Ferrariis. Johanni de Claveringe.
Henrico de Percy. Eustachio de Hacche. Roberto filio Walteri. Willielmo de
Leyburne. Willielmo le Latimer Juniori. Johanni de Bello-campo. Roberto de
Clifford. Willielmo de Grandisono. Roberto de Monte-alto. Philippo Darcy.
Johanni de Hastings. Johanni Extraneo. Johanni filio Reginaldi. Willielmo le
Vavassur. Nicholao de Astle. Willielmo Tuchet. Petro de Malolacu. Johanni de
Insula. Johanni de Ripariis. Johanni de Suley. Johanni de Mohun. Simoni de
Monte-acuto. Roberto filio Pagani. Thomae le Latimer. Hugoni de Curtenay.
Waltero de Huntercumb. Edmundo D'eyncurt. Edmundo de Hastings. Johanni de S.
Johanne (de Lageham.) Johanni de Lancastria. Though de Furnivall. Roberto de
Tateshale. Hugoni Bardolf. Radulpho Pipard. Roberto de Tony. Roberto de la
Ward. Though de Berkele. Alano la Zusche. Willielmo de Braiosa. Johanni Lovel (de
Tichmersh.) Petro Corbet. Henrico Ties. Willielmo Martin. Nicholao de Segrave.
Though de Multon. Briano filio Alani. Johanni ab Adam. Edmundo de Mortuo-mari.
Philippo de Kyme. Fulconi filio Warini. Johanni de Segrave. Eliae D'aubeney.
Roberto filio Rogeri. Edmundo Baroni de Stafford. Hugoni de Veere. Radulpho
filio Willielmi. Waltero de Faucumberge. Bogoni de Knovill. Radulpho Basset (de
Drayton.) Thomae de la Roche.


Adhuc Anno 30 Edw. I.
Clausae in dorso. m. 7.
REX venerabili in Christo Patri R. eadem gratia Archiepiscopo De Parliamento
prorogando usque Westmonasterium.
Cantuariensi, totius Angliae Primati, salutem. Quia Parliamentum, quod nuper
statueramus tenendum London' in instanti Festo S. Michaelis (prout nostrae
Literae vobis and aliis directae before continebant) quibusdam certis de
causis usque in Crastinum Festi S. Edwardi proximo futurum, duximus
prorogandum: Vobis mandamus, in fide and dilectione, quibus nobis tenemini,
firmiter injungentes; quod praedicto Parliamento in dicto Crastino apud Westm',
omnibus aliis praetermissis, personaliter intersitis; Et hoc, nullatenus
omittatis. Test Rege apud Jews 13. die Septembris.

Consimiles Literae diriguntur subscriptis, viz.

J. Karliol' Episcopo (caeterisque Episcopis.)

REX Edwardo Principi Walliae and Comiti Cestrensi, filio suo karissimo,
salutem. Quia Parliamentum, quod nuper statueramus tenendum, (etc.) vobis
mandamus, in fide and homagio, quibus nobis tenemini, firmiter injungentes,
quod praedicto Parliamento, etc. ut supra T. R. ut supra.

Consimiles Literae diriguntur subscriptis, viz. Johanni de Warenna, Comiti
Surr'. Roberto de Monte-alto. Rogero le Bigod, Comiti Norf. and Marescallo
Angliae. Johanni filio Reginaldi. Nicholao de Astle. Henrico de Lacy, Comiti
Lincoln'. Petro de Malolacu. Radulpho de Monte-hermer, Comiti Glouc' and Hertf.
Johanni de Ripariis. Johanni de Mohun. Humfrido de Bohun, Comiti Heref. and
Essex. Roberto filio Pagani. Hugoni de Curtenay. Thomae Comiti Lanc'. Edmundo
D'eyncurt. Guid' de Bello-campo, Comiti War'. Thomae de Furnivall. Roberto de
Veer, Comiti Oxon'. Hugoni de Bardolf. Gilberto de Vmframvill, Comiti de
Anegos. Roberto de Tony. Thomae de Berkele. Henrico de Lancastr'. Willielmo de
Brewosa. Adamaro de Valencia. Petro Corbet. Hugoni le Despenser. Willielmo
Martyn. Johanni de Ferrariis. Thomae de Multon. Henrico de Percy. Johanni ab
Adam. Roberto filio Walteri. Philippo de Kyme. Willielmo le Latymer Juniori.
Roberto filio Rogeri. Hugoni de Vere. Johanni Engayne. Waltero de Faucomberge.
Gilberto Pecehe. Radulpho Basset (de Drayton). Johanni de Clavering. Willielmo
de Roos (de Hamlak). Eustachio de Hacche. Willielmo de Ferrariis. Willielmo de
Leyburn. Rogero la War. Johanni de Bello-campo. Johanni Paynell. Willielmo de
Grandisono. Alexandro de Balliolo. Philippo Darey. Hugoni Pointz. Johanni
Extraneo. Rogero de Mortuo-mari. Willielmo le Vavassur. Willielmo de Rithre.
Johanni de Insula. Reginaldo de Gray. Johanni de Suley. Waltero de Muncy.

Adhuc eodem Anno 30 E. I.
Claus. in dorso m......
REX venerabili in Christo Patri R. eadem gratia, Cantuariensi De veniendo ad
Magnum Consilium, apud Westmonasterium.
Archiepiscopo, totius Angliae Primati, Salutem. Quia super quibusdam arduis
negotiis, nos and vos totumque Regnum nostrum specialiter tangentibus, quae
sine vobis and caeteris Praelatis ac Proceribus dicti Regni nolumus expediri;
vobiscum and cum eisdem Praelatis and Proceribus habere volumus Colloquium and
Tractatum; vobis mandamus, in fide and dilectione, quibus nobis tenemini,
firmiter injungentes; quod in Octabis Nativitatis Sancti Johannis Baptistae
proximo futuris, ad ultimum, apud Westm' modis omnibus personaliter intersitis,
nobiscum and cum caeteris Praelatis ac Proceribus supradictis, super dictis
negotiis tractaturi, vestrumque Consilium impensuri: Et hoc, nullatenus
omittatis. Test Rege apud Thurrock-grey 2do die Junij.

Consimiles Literae diriguntur subscriptis, viz.

J. Karliol' Episcopo, caeterisque Episcopis, etc.

REX Edwardo Principi Walliae, and Comiti Cestriae filio suo charissimo,
Salutem, Quia super quibusdam ardius negotiis, nos and vos, totumque Regnum
nostrum specialiter tangentibus, quae sine vobis and Praelatis and caeteris
Magnatibus dicti Regni nostri nolumus expedire, vobiscum and cum Praelatis and
Magnatibus habere volumus Colloquium and Tractatum; vobis in fide and homagio,
quibus nobis tenemini, firmiter injungentes; quod in Octabis Nativitatis Sancti
Johannis Baptistae, proximo futur', ad ultimum, apud Westm' modis omnibus
personaliter intersitis, nobiscum and cum Praelatis ac Magnatibus supradictis,
super dictis negotiis tractaturi, vestrumque Consilium impensuri. Et hoc
nullatenus omittatis. Test Rege apud Thurrock-grey 2do die Junij.
